content: Hello, I'd like to get permission to get write access on the mathlib github. My contributions will be mostly limited to graph theory. There isn't yet much of that in mathlib, but we (small reading course at McGill University we created to learn Lean) intend to add as much as possible of a the contents of standard introductory graph theory class to mathlib. Thanks!
My username is tjeremie
@maintainers :up:
Invitation sent!

Hello! I'm working on matrix group examples from the undergrad_todo. At the moment I've defined all the missing ones. Can you please give me access?
(username: vasnesterov)
@maintainers
cc @Kyle Miller who is also working on undergrad linear algebra
Invite sent.

@maintainers can you give me push access to the github repo (username pjbruin)? I'm planning to contribute to the character-table branch (and possibly other things useful for Burnside's theorem). Thanks!
Invite sent!
@Peter Bruin Voila: https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib/invitations

Hi all! My name is Alexis Leroux-Lapierre and I am a phd student from McGill university in Montreal working with @Jérémie Turcotte on a small reading course about graph theory in Lean. I'd like to get permission to get write access on the mathlib github. My contributions would be towards acyclic graphs and some connectivity lemmas.

Thanks in advance !

My github username is ALerouxLapierre
Welcome! Invite sent: https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib/invitations

Hey folks! I've been using Lean4 for quite awhile, but I've recently started doing some algebraic geometry with a friend in mathlib. I'd like to upstream some things as we go along. Could I get write access to github? Planning on contributing some missing definitions for localized modules, currently.
@Calvin Lee Please tell us your github username.

Oops! theorem proving fried my brain
https://github.com/4e554c4c
@Calvin Lee Voila :mail: : https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib/invitations

Hi! I've been working on the Borel hierarchy and I would like to ask for non-master access to the mathlib repo. My Github user is sterraf.
Thanks in advance!
@Pedro Sánchez Terraf Invite sent! https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib/invitations
Hi, I am working on wreath products and would like to ask for non-master access to the mathlib repo. My Github user name is b-reinke. Thanks!
@Bernhard Reinke Voila: https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib/invitations
